creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Dr and Mrs Sherman Lee
description: group of three figures near bottom hiking near the base of a steep valley and large boulder; first figure wears short grey jacket and carries a white and blue bundle across shoulders; center figure wears white robe with long black headdress; third, shorter figure wears blue robe and carries a gourd on back; long, curving formation (cloud bank? waterfall?) cuts across center from UL; foliage at center; towering, pointed mountain in background UR with pagoda (with light pinkish/brown wash of color) near its base
markings: ULC, square intaglio: 有恪之印; ULC, square relief: 聱牙齋; LRC, square intaglio: 夏XX難哉
title: Paying a Visit among Valleys and Mountains
